message:
Just installed VSCode on my personal custom made #Debian

Now installing the #mono framework. let's see where this goes.

data.message: Actually they also released official MS DotNet for Linux
Yes, but the installation instructions for ASP.NET say to install mono https://github.com/aspnet/Home/blob/dev/GettingStartedDeb.md
I got t this link from the VSCode website
Mohamed Elsherif do you have a link for .net for linux?

No, I just saw the slides on TechCrunch, the link is supposedly http://aka.ms/coreclr but it doesn't seem to work
http://techcrunch.com/2015/04/29/microsoft-launches-its-net-distribution-for-linux-and-mac/#.vuiywi:SID8
سؤال بخصوص جزء معين من البوست .ممكت توضحلي custom made دي مغير فيها ايه مثلا او هل مزود برامج معينة تكون موجودة by default ؟ و هل معدل علي الiso نفسها ولا عملت ايه ?

Mostafa Hussein What I mean by custom made: 1. Net Install small iso, 2. Manually install each package as needed. 3. No desktop environment (KDE,GNOME, MATE, Cinnamon) 4. I installed open box and even the file manager Thunar. 5. I installed the sound server to make sound. 6. I even compiled EMACS from source code and installed it. 7. I edited the xml file for conky to the right of the screen, and even the Panel on top (Tint) I made the XML for the settings.
Basically, I was trying to imitate a custom Debian called CrunchBang, a Debian OS with minimalist UI and services so it only starts at 150 MB (Crunchbang), my Debian starts at 75-85 MB :)
